intro: Pseudoraphis, commonly known as the desert spoon, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and the southwestern United States. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical leaves that resemble spoons, which are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Pseudoraphis species typically produce small, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow, white, or pink, often in clusters at the tips of the stems. These plants are popular in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and striking appearance.
